ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzyɛ́ʼ nkàŋnkáʼ tà à te pfó pɔ́ ncwò nkáʼ tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼa mvfó wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ aa ntsǒŋ, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ fÿɛ́.
en: “Truly I tell you, anyone who doesn’t enter the sheep pen by the gate but climbs in some other way is a thief and a robber.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbyɛ̀bmvfó, mbà à ge pfó pɔ́ ncwò nkáʼ.
en: The one who enters by the gate is the shepherd    of the sheep.   # 10:2 Mt 7:15

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à pyɛ́bɛ ncwò nkáʼ, à tsɔ́ʼ ncwò nkáʼ, menjʉ̀njÿò júʼ ngyè mbyɛ̀bmvfó. Á lɔg mezíŋ menjʉ̀njÿò mé, ńtóŋo wɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkẅɛ.
en: The gatekeeper opens it for him, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo pɔ́ fó nkáʼ ńkẅɛ tà ḿmag, à gwɔ́ mvfò, pɔ́ gwɔ́ nzèm, mélàʼmie pɔ́ lǐŋ ngyè ye.
en: When he has brought all his own outside, he goes ahead of them. The sheep follow him because they know his voice.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pɔ́ le cʉ́me nzèm nyìŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ wɔ́, pɔ́ ge kÿo yé kÿo, mélàʼmie pɔ́ té ngyè pʉ̀a mendyɛ̀ʼɛ liŋ.»
en: They will never follow a stranger; instead they will run away from him, because they don’t know the voice of strangers.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn sagánò mbwó pɔ́b, tá pɔ́ ké te júʼu mmó gie à lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Jesus gave them this figure of speech, but they did not understand   what he was telling them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́, ncwò nkáʼ menjʉ̀njyò à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: Jesus said again, “Truly I tell you, I am    the gate for the sheep.   # 10:7 Mt 7:15

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pie é ka vɔg ńtó, tá n tó yɔ́ɔn, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ metsǒŋ, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ mefÿɛ́. Tá menjʉ̀njÿò ka ké te ngyè yɔb júʼ.
en: All who came before me    are thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn’t listen to them.

ngiemboon: Ncwò nkáʼ à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ, nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfó na mèŋ ńkúu nkáʼ, mbà ngàŋ ge gÿo tsẅɛ́. À ge ne kúu nkáʼ, é kẅɛɛ páʼ à kwǒŋ, éfaʼa mmó mpfɛ̌.
en: I am the gate. If anyone enters by me, he will be saved and will come in and go out and find pasture.

ngiemboon: Antsǒŋ tó yé pɔ́ léjʉ, pɔ́ lézẅé, pɔ́ lécʉŋte. Mèŋ, n ka tǒ légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge gẅiin legwɔ́ gẅie aa kwàʼ wɛ̌ pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: A thief comes only to steal    and kill and destroy.   # 10:10 Jn 6:27 I have come so that they may have life and have it in abundance.

ngiemboon: Mbyɛ̀bmvfó wembòŋo à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ. Ambyɛ̀bmvfó wembòŋo, à náa twó yé ńtí njʉ̀njÿò yé.
en: “I am the good shepherd.    The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.   # 10:11 Mt 20:28; Mk 10:45; 2Co 5:21; Gl 3:13; 1Jn 3:16

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à laba yé pɔ́ nkáb, tà menjʉ̀njÿò té mé wɔ́, à te kwàʼ mbyɛ̀bmvfó wɔ́. À neŋé tà ńgyá atsò tó, á gwáʼa wɔ́b ńkÿo. Atsò gwoon tsɔ̌, ńgÿo apfwɔ̀ʼ sa jʉʼ.
en: The hired hand, since he is not the shepherd and doesn’t own the sheep, leaves them    and runs away when he sees a wolf   # 10:12 Lk 10:3 coming. The wolf then snatches and scatters them.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ gwáʼ menjʉ̀njÿò ńkÿo, mélàʼmie à ka tǒ pɔ́ ńdab nkáb. Encʉ̀ŋ menjʉ̀njÿò té ne ńkúu yé wɔ́.
en: This happens because he is a hired hand and doesn’t care about the sheep.

ngiemboon: Mbyɛ̀bmvfó wembòŋo aa mèŋ, n ne ńzsé menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ gíŋ ńne ńzsé wɔ́ɔn.
en: “I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and my own know me,

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ne ńzsé wɔ́ɔn, n gíŋ ńne ńzsé Tá wɔ̀ɔn. N náa twó yɔ́ɔn ńtí menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn.
en: just as the Father knows me, and I know the Father.    I lay down my life   # 10:15 Mt 20:28 for the sheep.

ngiemboon: N gǐŋ ńgẅiin tsɔ́ menjʉ̀njÿò mie é té tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼ wɔɔn wɔ́. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie n gʉa ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó. Pɔ́ yɔ́b ge gÿo júʼ ngyè yɔ̀ɔn, à cʉa púʼu, anùɔ menjʉ̀njÿò gwɔ́ yémɔʼɔ́, ambyɛ̀bɛ gwɔ́ wémɔʼɔ́.
en: But I have other sheep    that are not from this sheep pen; I must bring them also, and they will listen to my voice. Then there will be one flock, one shepherd.   # 10:16 Ezk 34:23; 37:24; Jn 11:52; 17:11,20–22; Eph 2:11–19

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋo wɔ́ɔn, mélàʼmie n náa twó yɔ́ɔn, tá ńgÿo ńgíŋ ńkẅé.
en: This is why the Father loves me,    because I lay down my life   # 10:17 1Jn 3:16 so that I may take it up again.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ zɔɔn te kuʼu le zẅé wɔ́ɔn mɔ́, mèŋ zɔ kwoŋo ńnáa twó yɔ́ɔn. N kuʼu léná, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋ ńkẅé. Áa mmó gie tá wɔ̀ɔn la tsẅi ngie n gÿo.»
en: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down on my own. I have the right to lay it down, and I have the right to take it up again. I have received this command from my Father.”

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn shwóŋè gíŋ ḿmaʼa fàgte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yúndà.
en: Again the Jews were divided   because of these words.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «E ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé. Aa pʉ̀a. À gɔɔn kɔ́ tà pi zẅíʼte?»
en: Many of them were saying, “He has a demon   and he’s crazy. Why do you listen to him? ”

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Yɛ̂ té shwóŋè nyìŋ gẅie ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé wɔ́. Ngwɔ́ ssé tepòŋ nyɛ́ʼ menÿɔ́g mefʉ̀?»
en: Others were saying, “These aren’t the words of someone who is demon-possessed. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind? ”

ngiemboon: Mé gwɔ́ Yelúzálèm ńne ńjÿó línɔ̀ɔn lélɔg ńkímte páʼ mé la gíŋ ńnyɛte jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ gie mé la cʉŋte. Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼʉ fÿɔ́g,
en: Then the Festival of Dedication took place in Jerusalem, and it was winter.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgwá ńgiŋte tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé, á jʉʼʉ ncwò kɔ̀ʼ Salémò.
en: Jesus was walking in the temple in Solomon’s Colonnade.

ngiemboon: Pa Yúndà leen ńké ńtÿɔ́ʼɔ Yěsô ńnéŋe soŋ, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Peg ge zẅíʼte tà kú pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼʉ kɔ́ tá ɔ̀ shwóŋo wég nyìŋ gẅie ɔɔ yé? Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Nzàʼnkÿo, ɔ̀ zyɛ́b zyɛ̌b éshwóŋo wég.»
en: The Jews surrounded him and asked, “How long are you going to keep us in suspense?   If you are the Messiah,  # 10:24 Mt 1:17; Eph 5:2 tell us plainly.”  # 10:24 Or openly, orpublicly,# 10:24 Mt 26:63; Lk 22:67; 2Co 3:12

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «N ně ńdáʼ shwóŋo gẅí, tá pi te ne ńzẅíŋe wɔ́. Mefàʼ mie n ne ńdɔgɔ lezíŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn éfaʼa, é ne ńdaʼte nyìŋ gẅie n gee yé.
en: “I did tell you and you don’t believe,” Jesus answered them. “The works    that I do in my Father’s name testify about me.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi te ne ńzába ntʉ́m na mèŋ wɔ́, mélàʼmie pi te na nùɔ menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: But you don’t believe because you are not of my sheep.   ,# 10:26 Jn 6:37; 8:47

ngiemboon: Menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn júʼ ngyè yɔɔn. Mèŋ, n zsé wɔ́b, pɔ́ cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: My sheep hear my voice, I know them, and they follow me.

ngiemboon: N náa legwɔ́ temì mbwó pɔ́b, pɔ́ téen ńdáʼa ńgíŋe ńkaa ndòon temì wɔ́. Sɔɔn nyìŋ piŋ te kuʼu léfó mbwó mèŋ, ésaʼa wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: I give them eternal life,    and they will never perish.   # 10:28 Mt 10:42; Mk 9:41; Lk 21:18; Jn 3:16; 6:27,39; 17:12; 18:9; 2Co 4:9; 2Jn 8 No one will snatch   # 10:28 1Th 4:17 them out of my hand.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn la náa wɔ́b né mèŋ. À gẅiin tʉ̀ ńcʉa shúm ntsèm, sɔɔn nyìŋ te kuʼu léfó mbwó Tá ésaʼa wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: My Father,    who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of the Father’s hand.

ngiemboon: Peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ tàʼ nyìŋ.»
en: I and the Father are one.”

ngiemboon: Pa Yúndà gíŋ ńdag metǒon, lélɔg ńtémte Yěsô ńzẅé.
en: Again the Jews picked up rocks to stone him.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «N ka gÿo pi gyá mefàʼ mbòŋo tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn mie é fóo mbwó Tá wɔ̀ɔn, pi laga metǒon lélɔg ńtémte wɔ́ɔn ńzẅé páʼɔɔn ńtíi yɛ̌ mǒ?»
en: Jesus replied, “I have shown you many good works    from the Father. For which of these works are you stoning me? ”

ngiemboon: Pa Yúndà tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Peg těen faʼa lélɔg metǒon ńtémte gú ńzẅé, ńtí pɔ́ tsɔ́ fàʼa mbòŋo wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nue ɔ̀ zoonté Ssé. Gù gẅie ɔ̀ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ɔ̀ cʉʼʉ́ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie ɔɔ Ssé.»
en: “We aren’t stoning   you for a good work,” the Jews answered, “but for blasphemy, because you #— #being a man #— #make yourself God.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Mé la te ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ gí ngie Ssé gɔɔn ngie: “N gɔ̌ɔn ngie pi gwɔ́ pɔ́ messé wáa?”
en: Jesus answered them, “Isn’t it written in your law,    I said, you are gods?   # 10:34 Ps 82:6,# 10:34 Ps 82:6

ngiemboon: Pege metsèm ne ńzsé ngie ammó gie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ Ssé, á téen ńdáʼa ńkúbe wɔ́. À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ gie Ssé la gɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a pie à gɔɔn nò yé mbwó pɔ́b ée messé,
en: If he called those to whom the word    of God came ‘gods’ #— #and the Scripture   # 10:35 Mt 26:54 cannot be broken #— #

ngiemboon: m biŋ ńtyé páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie Tá wɔ̀ɔn Ssé la tsɔ́ʼ ńtúmo tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, mélàʼakɔ́ n gɔ̌ɔn ngie: “N gee Míŋ Ssé, pi gɔɔn ngie n zoonté Ssé?”
en: do you say, ‘You are blaspheming’ to the one the Father set apart and sent into the world, because I said: I am the Son of God?

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn te faʼ mefàʼ Tá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, tà pi záb ntʉ́m na mèŋ.
en: If I am not doing my Father’s works,    don’t believe me.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn faʼ, á fó ńgwɔ́ gie pi te záb ntʉ́m na mèŋ wɔ́, pi zẅíŋ mefàʼ ŋwɛ́. À cʉa púʼu, pi leen ńké ńzsé mboŋó ngie Tá wɔ̀ɔn aa né mèŋ, mèŋ, n gwɔ́ né yé.»
en: But if I am doing them and you don’t believe me, believe the works. This way you will know and understand    that the Father is in me and I in the Father.”   # 10:38 Jn 14:10; 1Jn 5:20

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńgíŋ faʼ shÿó légwoon yé, tá á tsẅíle na mbwó mɔ́b.
en: Then they were trying again to seize him,   but he escaped their grasp.  # 10:39 Lk 4:30

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò tɔ́g, Yěsô gíŋ ḿbiŋe na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ, á jʉʼ gie Jÿâŋ la zye lénuʼ pʉ̀a ntse wó, ńnéŋe wó.
en: So he departed again across the Jordan   to the place where John  # 10:40 Mk 1:4 had been baptizing earlier, and he remained there.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Jÿâŋ la te gÿo tsɔ̌ ndàagyá wɔ́, táʼ, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à la gɔɔn na mbàŋa wɔɔn wɔ́ɔ, á laa nò nénʉ́.»
en: Many came to him   and said, “John never did a sign, but everything John said about this man was true.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn na pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉʼó, é leen ńké ńzáb ntʉ́m na Yěsô.
en: And many believed in him there.
